The federal program rules require that each student get a complete meal to have the fee waived. Buying extras or a la carte items will result in a charge on the student’s lunch account. No action is required by our families; this will be an automated process on our side.
Parents, watch your email Friday for important information about our boxed meal pickup offering for face-to-face and virtual students
If you feel you qualify for meal benefits, be sure to apply at http://www.lunchapplication.com. To check out the daily menus, head over to https://york.nutrislice.com/.

We are excited to announce that York School District One was the recipient of a federal grant to improve school safety from the Department of Justice's Office of Community Oriented Policing Services (COPS Office). York One was one of only 3 districts in South Carolina to receive this competitive funding, amounting to over $330,000!
The district plans to use the funds to continue to secure our school campuses, implementing a secure badging system for building access by our teachers and staff, as well as the purchase of other safety items.
Many thanks to our grant writer Lisa Spangler, our School Safety team, as well as York Police Department, York County Sheriff's Office, York County Office of Emergency Management, York County Department of Public Safety Communications, and City of York Fire Department, SC for their involvement in this grant application!

South Carolina Department of Education
May 5 at 12:30 PM ·

May 4-8, 2020 is Teacher Appreciation Week!

We are kicking off our celebration of the teaching profession by recognizing our five finalists for South Carolina Teacher of the Year. Last month, Superintendent Molly Spearman surprised Shawn Norris, Sarah Gams, Tanya Peckham, Ashley Bennett, and Richard Whitmore with news they had been selected as finalists for the state's highest teaching honor.

The finalists have since been interviewed by a team of expert judges who will decide which educator will become the 2021 S.C. Teacher of the Year. Each finalist receives $10,000 and the winner receives a total of $25,000 and a brand new BMW to use while serving in the position. The winner will be announced at the annual gala which will be rescheduled for later this year.

Congratulations to these amazing teachers and THANK YOU for representing the over 50,000 teachers across our state so well!

Thank you!

January is School Board Recognition Month. York School District One joins school districts throughout the state and nation to celebrate School Board Recognition Month in January. More than 600 locally-elected school board members throughout the state are being recognized by schools and communities for their service and dedication to public education.

The theme “School Board Strong” highlights the fact that school board members are elected by the people in their local communities to represent their voice and to ensure the success of schools and students.

As a part of School Board Recognition Month, York School District One board members participated in an official signing of the South Carolina School Board Member Ethical Principles during their January school board meeting. By signing the principles, school board members publicly vowed to uphold effective governance principles and pledged to improve public education in their community.

Thank you to the members of the Board of Trustees for your service to our school district and community, keeping us Connected As One!
